name: Michele Ferrari
description: Threshold-focused methodology with high volume of sub-threshold and threshold work. Emphasizes training at anaerobic threshold as primary adaptation driver with minimal super-threshold efforts.
author: Based on Dr. Michele Ferrari's training methodology and 53x12.com philosophy

philosophy.notes: Threshold method: mostly sub-threshold and threshold work (91-101% FTP). Super-threshold rarely. Twice weekly threshold sessions. Medio (tempo) up to 20-40% of volume. Aggressive weight management with food weighing. Two-week max calorie deficit blocks. Famous quote: 'We never, ever, ever, ever, ever trained above threshold.'

adjust_intensity_up: Power well-controlled. Increase by {{percent}}% to extend threshold.
adjust_intensity_up_rationale: Power output is precise and HR drift is minimal at current threshold load. Your body is adapting well to sub-threshold work. Increasing intensity extends time at threshold - the primary driver of adaptation.
adjust_intensity_down: HR drift too high. Reduce by {{percent}}% to stay in target zone.
adjust_intensity_down_rationale: HR drift exceeds threshold zone parameters. We never train above threshold for a reason - it compromises the precise zone training that builds power. Reduce intensity to maintain the method.
extend_recovery: Recovery incomplete. Extend by {{seconds}} seconds only if necessary.
extend_recovery_rationale: Recovery metrics show incomplete restoration. While we maintain the plan where possible, incomplete recovery between threshold blocks compromises the quality we demand. Extend only what's necessary.
skip_remaining_on_intervals: Power dropping significantly. Terminate and analyze why.
skip_remaining_on_intervals_rationale: Power decline indicates you've exceeded your threshold capacity for today. This is valuable data. We terminate, analyze why - nutrition, sleep, weight, stress - and adjust tomorrow. Never compromise the method by pushing through failure.

completion: Session complete. Threshold work done. Check weight and recovery.
Workout executed. Upload data for analysis.
Training done. Focus on nutrition and rest.
